title: Exit with nonzero status if `spack install` fails
body:
Have `spack install` exit with a nonzero status (e.g., `sys.exit(1)` or `exit(EXIT_FAILURE)`) if one or more packages could not be built. Spack 0.16.2 does not do this.

### Rationale

1. If some packages could not be installed, this is an error and consequently the exit status should not be zero.
2. Always returning zero breaks any attempt at scripting.

### Description

There is no alternative to setting the exit status because
* shells have built-in features working the exit status of a program,
* processes are given the exit code of their child processes (e.g., by `wait()`), and
* continuous integration environments check for nonzero exit statuses to detect pipeline failures.

Parsing standard error is error prone and unreliable.

### Additional information

I am running Spack builds in a container in a continuous integration (CI) environment and everything always succeeds when `spack install` actually fails to install half of the packages.

### General information

- [x] I have run `spack --version` and reported the version of Spack
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
